intro: Cynoglossum microglochin, commonly known as the narrow-leaved bellflower, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It features lance-shaped leaves that are typically hairy and arranged in a basal rosette. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to purple, often with a distinctive white throat. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Cynoglossum microglochin is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and rocky habitats.
